sentence: How do you know when the moon is going broke? when its down to its last quarter.
explanation: In a division of a year, a quarter represents a period of three months.
first_new_sentence: The city council approved the budget for the next quarter.
second_new_sentence: The last quarter of the moon is a phase where half of the moon is illuminated.

sentence: What do you call a phallic music scale, crushed under a piano? d-flat
explanation: A flat surface allows for easier stacking of items.
first_new_sentence: The flat attitude of the film didnt sit well with the critics.
second_new_sentence: Flat can refer to a musical note that is lowered by a half step.

sentence: What did the janitor say when he jumped out of the closet? supplies!
explanation: Schools ensure they have enough supplies for the semester.
first_new_sentence: The definition of supplies includes the goods and materials needed for a specific purpose.
second_new_sentence: The janitors job relies heavily on various cleaning supplies.

sentence: What goes tick tock, woof woof? a watchdog.
explanation: I need to watch the new series that everyone is talking about.
first_new_sentence: The watch on his wrist was given to him by his grandfather.
second_new_sentence: A watchdog is a type of dog used for guarding property.

sentence: What is hard when it goes in and soft and sticky when it comes out? a chewing gum
explanation: The dentist advised me to avoid chewing gum to protect my teeth.
first_new_sentence: The gum on the sidewalk was impossible to remove without scraping.
second_new_sentence: Gum can refer to a type of candy that is chewed but not swallowed.

sentence: What did the leper say to the prostitute? (nsfw) you can keep the tip...
explanation: You should always leave a tip for good service.

second_new_sentence: The tip portion of the mountains was covered in snow.
